page.title: 20Landuse in Ousden
page.content: The landscape in this small part of Suffolk is fairly typical of the rest of the county. The undulating countryside is mainly arable, vast fields under cultivation worked by modern machinery, the farms only employing a few labourers. The whole scene gives an impression of good husbandry, well kept verges, stout gates and well maintained properous farm houses. Mnay of the hedges have disappeared to accommodate the machinery and to make full use of the land. However small copses have been left for natural habitats for pheasants and other game. One of the biggest controversies this decade is the burning of the useless straw, with the attendant risks of fire and the spread of soot and ash. Most farmers however are caring members of the community anxious to preserve the area
